definition: to change schools/to transfer to another college
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: He transferred his son to another school.
sentences.chinese: 他將兒子轉學到另一所學校。

sentences.english: After she changed schools, she began to make much better progress.
sentences.chinese: 她轉學以後，開始有長足的進步。

sentences.english: Tom transferred to an American college in 2007.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆在2007年轉學到一所美國的大學。

sentences.english: Moving would take Tutti out of school again.
sentences.chinese: 搬家得讓圖蒂再次轉學。

sentences.english: He asked if they would take him instead as a transfer student — immediately.
sentences.chinese: 他問他們是否可以讓他作爲轉學生過來，立即。

sentences.english: Changing schools made a big difference to my life.
sentences.chinese: 轉學對我一生有重大影響。

sentences.english: Changing jobs made a big difference to my life.
sentences.chinese: 轉學對我的一生有重大影響。

sentences.english: Kelly transferred from Cornell University to Duke University.
sentences.chinese: 凱莉從康乃爾大學轉學到了杜克大學。

sentences.english: The various design parameters are introduced before moving on to a six-segment airfoil.
sentences.chinese: 各設計參數介紹轉學至六部分機翼。

sentences.english: According to what Ned told me, he had transferred to another school.
sentences.chinese: 奈德告訴我說，他已經轉學去另外一所學校了。

sentences.english: You can't take the transfer students'exam without your transcripts .
sentences.chinese: 沒有成績證明書，你就不能參加轉學考試。

sentences.english: The above is only a partial listing of universities where transfer students have been welcomed.
sentences.chinese: 以上僅是部分接受易三倉學生轉學的海外大學名單。

sentences.english: So was a girl in my class named Paris.
sentences.chinese: 班裏有個叫帕瑞絲的女孩也剛轉學來。

sentences.english: He wanted to change from Physics to Chemistry.
sentences.chinese: 他想從學物理轉學化學。

sentences.english: Constant also transfer the gold degree, bead dropped out.
sentences.chinese: 而金度恆也轉學，珠英退學了。

definition: to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
(idiom) due to an unexpected turn of events
student of a senior high school
to overdose on supplementary medicine/to cram too hard
to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
to drop out of school/to leave off studying/to interrupt one's studies
